item.title: [Hyperion] Fences [Hyperion]
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:16, topic:540784”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=659650.msg4411184#msg4411184 date=1393777421]
Second: I think you overcomplicated it a bit. Although I love your use of interfaces, I don’t know if it’s necessary. You could have easily condensed the four gate classes into one and eliminated the interface altogether. This would bring you from 7 classes made for a simple thing like gate handling to 3.
[/quote]If you’re given an OOP language, why not use OOP?[/quote]
Because if you make 7 classes for a simple thing like fences, before you know it you have 1000 classes for a single server.
There are times to use it and there are times where it’s not necessary to. Just because you can doesn’t mean you should.

Read full topic

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:6, topic:540784”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=659650.msg4411187#msg4411187 date=1393778006]

First: I personally would’ve used an enum for storing the fence data. I don’t know if there’s more but you only have 10 listed here so I don’t see any advantage to having the data in xml rather than an enum; however, if there’s a lot more fences that aren’t added here then I can see why you’d use xml.

i think runescape has more than 10 fences throughout the entire map…
[/quote]
I don’t know, fences are pretty rare. There’s like four in lumbridge alone so I’d have to agree but I really don’t know the specifics alone[/quote]
There’s probably 50 fences in the game maybe more so I don’t think it would work in an enum.

item.title: [Hyperion] Fences [Hyperion]
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Although I think this is done pretty well, there’s a few things that could/should be changed.

First: I personally would’ve used an enum for storing the fence data. I don’t know if there’s more but you only have 10 listed here so I don’t see any advantage to having the data in xml rather than an enum; however, if there’s a lot more fences that aren’t added here then I can see why you’d use xml.

Second: I think you overcomplicated it a bit. Although I love your use of interfaces, I don’t know if it’s necessary. You could have easily condensed the four gate classes into one and eliminated the interface altogether. This would bring you from 7 classes made for a simple thing like gate handling to 3.

Other than that (and those are really just personal preferences) this looks pretty good.

Read full topic

item.title: [Hyperion] Fences [Hyperion]
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

This is only for fences.

So make a new xml file named gates.xml

<list> <gate> <orientation>LEFT</orientation> <direction>EAST</direction> <x>3186</x> <y>3269</y> </gate> <gate> <orientation>LEFT</orientation> <direction>NORTH</direction> <x>3180</x> <y>3289</y> </gate> </list>

Made some gates already. Now you need to parse this file however you parse xml in your server and then for each gate make a new instance of this class.

[code=java]/**

  • Gate
  • March 1, 2014
  • Dan0194
    */
    package org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates;

import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateManager.GateDirection;
import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateManager.GateOrientation;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Location;

public class Gate {

/**
 * the id of the gate
 */
private int id;
/**
 * the orientation of the gate
 */
private String orientation;
/**
 * The direction of the gate
 */
private String direction;
/**
 * the x coordinate
 */
private int x;
/**
 * the y coordinate
 */
private int y;
/**
 * is the gate opened
 */
private boolean open;

/**
 * @return id
 */
public int getId() {
	return id;
}

public Gate() { /** default constructer */ };

public Gate(boolean open, GateDirection direction) {
	this.open = open;
	this.direction = direction.toString();
}
/**
 * @return gateOrientation
 */
public GateOrientation getOrientation() {
	GateOrientation gateOrientation = Enum.valueOf(GateOrientation.class, orientation);
	return gateOrientation;
}

/**
 * @return gateDirection
 */
public GateDirection getDirection() {
	GateDirection gateDirection = Enum.valueOf(GateDirection.class, direction);
	return gateDirection;
}

/**
 * @return location
 */
public Location getLocation() {
	return Location.create(x, y, 0);
}

/**
 * @return open
 */
public boolean isOpen() {
	return open;
}

}[/code]

Now make an interface named GateHandler

[code=java]/**

  • GateHandler
  • March 1, 2014
  • Dan0194
    */
    package org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates;

import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player;

public interface GateHandler {

void openGate(Player player, Gate gate, int x, int y);

void closeGate(Player player, Gate gate, int x, int y);

}[/code]

Now make another new class and name in GateManager

/**
 * GateManager
 * 
 * March 1, 2014
 * 
 * Dan0194
 */
package org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates;

import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.impl.*;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Location;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player;

public class GateManager {

	/**
	 * Direction of the gate
	 */
	public enum GateOrientation {
		LEFT, RIGHT;
	}

	/**
	 * Where the gate is positioned
	 */
	public enum GateDirection {
		/**
		 * The South gate handler
		 */
		SOUTH(new SouthGate()), 
		/**
		 * The east gate handler
		 */
		EAST(new EastGate()), 
		/**
		 * The north gate handler
		 */
		NORTH(new NorthGate()), 
		/**
		 * The west gate handler
		 */
		WEST(new WestGate());

		private GateHandler gateHandler;

		GateDirection(GateHandler gateHandler) {
			this.gateHandler = gateHandler;
		}

		public GateHandler getGateHandler() {
			return gateHandler;
		}
	}

	/**
	 * the singleton
	 */
	public static final GateManager gatesManager = new GateManager();

	/**
	 * The map
	 */
	private static Map<Location, Gate> gates = new HashMap<Location, Gate>();

	/**
	 * @param player
	 * @param id
	 * @param x
	 * @param y
	 */
	public GateManager openGate(final Player player, final int x,
			final int y) {
		final Gate gate = gates.get(Location.create(x, y, 0));
			if(gate.isOpen()) {
			gate.getDirection().getGateHandler()
					.closeGate(player, gate, x, y);
			} else {
				gate.getDirection().getGateHandler()
				.openGate(player, gate, x, y);
			}
		return this;
	}
	
	/**
	 * Gets the gates partner
	 * @param gate
	 */
	public GateManager getGatePartner(Gate gate) {
		final int x = gate.getDirection() == GateDirection.NORTH ? +(gate
				.getOrientation() == GateOrientation.LEFT ? 1 : -1) : gate
				.getDirection() == GateDirection.SOUTH ? +(gate
				.getOrientation() == GateOrientation.LEFT ? -1 : 1) : 0;
		final int y = gate.getDirection() == GateDirection.EAST ? +(gate
				.getOrientation() == GateOrientation.LEFT ? -1 : 1)
				: gate.getDirection() == GateDirection.WEST ? +(gate
						.getOrientation() == GateOrientation.LEFT ? 1 : -1) : 0;
		final GateOrientation gateOrientation = gate.getOrientation() == GateOrientation.LEFT ? GateOrientation.RIGHT
				: GateOrientation.LEFT;
		Gate partnerGate = new Gate(gate.getLocation().getX() + x, gate
				.getLocation().getY() + y, gate.getDirection(), gateOrientation);
		gates.put(partnerGate.getLocation(), partnerGate);
		return this;
	}

	/**
	 * @param gate
	 */
	public void bind(Gate gate) {
		gates.put(gate.getLocation(), gate);
		this.getGatePartner(gate);
	}

	/**
	 * @return gates
	 */
	public Map<Location, Gate> getGates() {
		return gates;
	}

	/**
	 * @return gatesManager
	 */
	public static GateManager getGateManager() {
		return gatesManager;
	}
}

Now the 4 direction classes.

EastGate.class
[spoiler]

[code=java]/**

  • EastGate
  • March 1, 2014
  • Dan0194
    */
    package org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.impl;

import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.Gate;
import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateHandler;
import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateManager;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Location;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player;

public class EastGate implements GateHandler {

/**
 * (non-Javadoc)
 * 
 * @see org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateHandler#openGate(org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player,
 *      org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.Gate, int, int)
 */
@Override
public void openGate(Player player, Gate gate, int x, int y) {
	switch (gate.getOrientation()) {
	case LEFT:
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y);
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y - 1);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1551, x, y, 1, 0);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1554, x + 1, y, 1, 0);
		GateManager
				.getGateManager()
				.getGates()
				.put(Location.create(x, y, 0),
						new Gate((true), gate.getDirection()));
		break;
	case RIGHT:
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y);
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y + 1);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1554, x + 1, y + 1, 1, 0);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1551, x, y + 1, 1, 0);
		GateManager
				.getGateManager()
				.getGates()
				.put(Location.create(x, y + 1, 0),
						new Gate((true), gate.getDirection()));
		break;
	}
}

/**
 * (non-Javadoc)
 * 
 * @see org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateHandler#closeGate(org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player,
 *      org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.Gate, int, int)
 */
@Override
public void closeGate(Player player, Gate gate, int x, int y) {
	player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y);
	player.getActionSender().removeObject(x + 1, y);
	player.getActionSender().sendObject(1553, x, y, 0, 0);
	player.getActionSender().sendObject(1551, x, y - 1, 0, 0);

}

}
[/code][/spoiler]

NorthGate.class
[spoiler][code=java]/**

  • NorthGate
  • March 1, 2014
  • Dan0194
    */
    package org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.impl;

import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.Gate;
import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateHandler;
import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateManager;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Location;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player;

public class NorthGate implements GateHandler {

/**
 * (non-Javadoc)
 * 
 * @see org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateHandler#openGate(org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player,
 *      org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.Gate, int, int, int)
 */
@Override
public void openGate(Player player, Gate gate, int x, int y) {
	switch (gate.getOrientation()) {
	case LEFT:
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y);
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x + 1, y);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1554, x + 1, y - 2, 2, 0);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1551, x + 1, y - 1, 2, 0);
		GateManager
				.getGateManager()
				.getGates()
				.put(Location.create(x + 1, y - 1, 0),
						new Gate((true), gate.getDirection()));
		break;
	case RIGHT:
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y);
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x - 1, y);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1551, x, y - 1, 2, 0);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1554, x, y - 2, 2, 0);
		GateManager
				.getGateManager()
				.getGates()
				.put(Location.create(x, y - 1, 0),
						new Gate((true), gate.getDirection()));
		break;
	}
}

/**
 * (non-Javadoc)
 * 
 * @see org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateHandler#closeGate(org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player,
 *      org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.Gate, int, int, int)
 */
@Override
public void closeGate(Player player, Gate gate, int x, int y) {
	player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y);
	player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y - 1);
	player.getActionSender().sendObject(1551, x, y + 1, 3, 0);
	player.getActionSender().sendObject(1553, x - 1, y + 1, 3, 0);
}

}
[/code][/spoiler]

SouthGate.class
[spoiler]

[code=java]
/**

  • SouthGate
  • March 1, 2014
  • Dan0194
    */
    package org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.impl;

import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.Gate;
import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateHandler;
import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateManager;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Location;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player;

public class SouthGate implements GateHandler {

/**
 * (non-Javadoc)
 * 
 * @see org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateHandler#openGate(org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player,
 *      org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.Gate, int, int)
 */
@Override
public void openGate(Player player, Gate gate, int x, int y) {
	switch (gate.getOrientation()) {
	case LEFT:
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y);
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x - 1, y);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1554, x - 1, y + 2, 0, 0);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1551, x - 1, y + 1, 0, 0);
		GateManager
				.getGateManager()
				.getGates()
				.put(Location.create(x - 1, y + 1, 0),
						new Gate((true), gate.getDirection()));
		break;
	case RIGHT:
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y);
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x + 1, y);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1551, x, y + 1, 0, 0);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1554, x, y + 2, 0, 0);
		GateManager
				.getGateManager()
				.getGates()
				.put(Location.create(x, y + 1, 0),
						new Gate((true), gate.getDirection()));
		break;
	}
}

/**
 * (non-Javadoc)
 * 
 * @see org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateHandler#closeGate(org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player,
 *      org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.Gate, int, int)
 */
@Override
public void closeGate(Player player, Gate gate, int x, int y) {
	player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y);
	player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y + 1);
	player.getActionSender().sendObject(1551, x, y - 1, 1, 0);
	player.getActionSender().sendObject(1553, x + 1, y - 1, 1, 0);

}

}[/code][/spoiler]

WestGate.class
[spoiler][code=java]
/**

  • WestGate
  • March 1, 2014
  • Dan0194
    */
    package org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.impl;

import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.Gate;
import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateHandler;
import org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateManager;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Location;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player;

public class WestGate implements GateHandler {

/**
 * (non-Javadoc)
 * 
 * @see org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateHandler#openGate(org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player,
 *      org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.Gate, int, int)
 */
@Override
public void openGate(Player player, Gate gate, int x, int y) {
	switch (gate.getOrientation()) {
	case LEFT:
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y);
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y + 1);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1551, x - 1, y, 3, 0);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1554, x - 2, y, 3, 0);
		GateManager
				.getGateManager()
				.getGates()
				.put(Location.create(x - 1, y, 0),
						new Gate((true), gate.getDirection()));
		break;
	case RIGHT:
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y);
		player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y - 1);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1554, x - 2, y - 1, 3, 0);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(1551, x - 1, y - 1, 3, 0);
		GateManager
				.getGateManager()
				.getGates()
				.put(Location.create(x - 1, y - 1, 0),
						new Gate((true), gate.getDirection()));
		break;
	}
}

/**
 * (non-Javadoc)
 * 
 * @see org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.GateHandler#closeGate(org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player,
 *      org.hyperion.rs2.content.world.gates.Gate, int, int)
 */
@Override
public void closeGate(Player player, Gate gate, int x, int y) {
	player.getActionSender().removeObject(x, y);
	player.getActionSender().removeObject(x - 1, y);
	player.getActionSender().sendObject(1553, x + 1, y + 1, 0, 0);
	player.getActionSender().sendObject(1551, x + 1, y, 0, 0);

}

}[/code]
[/spoiler]

Now in your first click object packet add

if(GateManager.getGateManager().getGates().containsKey(Location.create(x, y, 0))) { GateManager.getGateManager().openGate(player, id, x, y); return; }

I am open to constructive criticism.

Read full topic
